trans-unit.source: The [Cloud Platform Integration Framework (CPIF)](azure-architectures-cpif-overview.md) provides workload integration guidance for onboarding applications into a Microsoft Cloud Solution.

trans-unit.source: CPIF describes how organizations, customers and partners should design and deploy Cloud-targeted workloads utilizing the hybrid cloud platform and management capabilities of Azure, System Center and Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: Offsite Batch Processing Tier
trans-unit.target: Offsite Batch Processing Tier

trans-unit.source: The Offsite Batch Processing Tier design pattern details the Azure features and services required to deliver backend data processing that is both fault tolerant and scalable.
trans-unit.target: The Offsite Batch Processing Tier design pattern details the Azure features and services required to deliver backend data processing that is both fault tolerant and scalable.

trans-unit.source: These services are realized as worker roles in cloud services on Azure, which currently can be deployed to any Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: These services are realized as worker roles in cloud services on Azure, which currently can be deployed to any Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: Batch processing workloads are unique in that they typically provide little or no user interface.
trans-unit.target: Batch processing workloads are unique in that they typically provide little or no user interface.

trans-unit.source: An example of this type of workload on premises would be a Windows Service running on Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: An example of this type of workload on premises would be a Windows Service running on Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: When considering this type of workload in a cloud environment, it would be wasteful to deploy an entire server to run a workload, when what is really required is compute, storage and network connectivity.
trans-unit.target: When considering this type of workload in a cloud environment, it would be wasteful to deploy an entire server to run a workload, when what is really required is compute, storage and network connectivity.

trans-unit.source: The worker role is the implementation of this on Azure.
trans-unit.target: The worker role is the implementation of this on Azure.

trans-unit.source: By definition, a batch processing job that is run in Azure is a workload that connects to a resource, provides some business logic (computing) and provides some output.
trans-unit.target: By definition, a batch processing job that is run in Azure is a workload that connects to a resource, provides some business logic (computing) and provides some output.

trans-unit.source: The input and output resources are defined by the user and can range from flat files, blobs in Azure blob storage, a NoSQL database, or relational databases.
trans-unit.target: The input and output resources are defined by the user and can range from flat files, blobs in Azure blob storage, a NoSQL database, or relational databases.

trans-unit.source: The business logic is implemented in an Azure worker role, typically by defining the required business logic in a .NET library.
trans-unit.target: The business logic is implemented in an Azure worker role, typically by defining the required business logic in a .NET library.

trans-unit.source: While deployment of a worker role to Azure is a simple operation, deploying a worker role that is fault tolerant and scalable requires a design which takes into consideration how the service is executed and maintained within Azure.
trans-unit.target: While deployment of a worker role to Azure is a simple operation, deploying a worker role that is fault tolerant and scalable requires a design which takes into consideration how the service is executed and maintained within Azure.

trans-unit.source: This pattern will detail the design which considers these requirements and describes how these can be implemented.
trans-unit.target: This pattern will detail the design which considers these requirements and describes how these can be implemented.
